results.title: Diamond Island
results.creator_credit: Aurora Films, Davy Chou, Charlotte Vincent and Claire Maugendre
results.brief_description: Bora, an 18-year-old, leaves his village to work on the construction sites of Diamond Island, a project for an ultra-modern paradise for the rich and a symbol of tomorrow’s Cambodia.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Aurora Films, Davy Chou, Charlotte Vincent and Claire Maugendre
results.description: Bora, an 18-year-old, leaves his village to work on the construction sites of Diamond Island, a project for an ultra-modern paradise for the rich and a symbol of tomorrow’s Cambodia. He befriends his fellow workers and finds his elder brother, the charismatic Solei, who went missing five years earlier. Solei introduces him into an exciting world, that of an urban and wealthy youth, its girls, nights and illusions.
description_for_label: Bora, an 18-year-old, leaves his village to work on the construction sites of Diamond Island, a project for an ultra-modern paradise for the rich and a symbol of tomorrow’s Cambodia. He befriends his fellow workers and finds his elder brother, the charismatic Solei, who went missing five years earlier. Solei introduces him into an exciting world, that of an urban and wealthy youth, its girls, nights and illusions.

results.title: Dialogues with madwomen
results.creator_credit: Allie Light, Harry Saraf, Saraf Films and Light
results.brief_description: An exceptional documentary which challenges the myths, stereotypes and fears surrounding mental illness. The director herself was institutionalised for depression in the 1960s and in this film she conducts a dialogue with six other women who have all been diagnosed as mentally ill. Whether affected by schizophrenia, manic-depression or dissassociated identitities the women are all articulate and have all been able to reclaim a self-respect and self- determination that was initially denied to them by medical practitioners. This film does not claim to “solve” the riddle of madness: the women describe damage they suffered from doctors and hospitals but they also talk about the effectiveness of certain therapies and treatments. But what frustrated them all is the failure of institutionalised medicine to integrate their experiences of incest and abuse into their psychological models, or to understand the specific psychological traumas arising from racism and ethnic dislocation. The film uses symbolic imagery and dramatic re-enactments to represent the womens’ history, dreams and memories. “Dialogues with Madwomen”, by presenting the women’s own stories, tears away the heavy drapes of prejudice that dominate our thinking about mental illness.

results.title: Dial M for murder (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock agreed to direct this masterful adaption of the broadway play by Frederick Knott merely to fulfil studio contractual obligations but “Dial M for murder” became one of his most acclaimed thrillers. Anxious to inherit his wife’s fortune, society playboy Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) ingeniously plots her murder. Blackmailing a former associate with a criminal record, he arranges what appears to be a perfect crime. However, his scheme is foiled when Margot (Grace Kelly) stabs her attacker with scissors. Wendice must now take his sinister web of intrigue in a different direction to cover his tracks. Co-starring John Williams.

results.title: Dial M for Murder
results.brief_description: An ex-tennis pro carries out a plot to have his wife murdered after discovering she is having an affair, and assumes she will soon leave him for the other man anyway. When things go wrong, he improvises a new plan—to frame her for murder instead.

constellations_other.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_other.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

results.title: Dial history
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and black and white and audio
results.brief_description: In the found footage tradition, ‘Dial H-I-S-T-O-R-Y’ takes the viewer on a journey through media footage of airplane hijacking and other terrorism.

results.title: Diagnosis of speech and reading problems
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates various tests that the teacher can use to evaluate a student’s neurological development. These include visual pursuit, cortical dominance, cross-pattern creeping, and similar procedures. Slow-motion scenes and freeze frames enhance the value of this training film. (Teacher education)

results.title: Diagnosis and planning adjustment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”.
A dramatization of an incident showing a counsellor’s diagnosis and treatment of a maladjusted student’s emotional problem is used in explaining the role of the counsellor in the over-all school program. Describes the steps in successful counselling - determining the cause of the problem, easing the student’s anxieties and strain, planning courses of action, and assisting the student in making new adjustments.

results.title: Diagnosing group operations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Uses demonstrations and discussion to consider the causes of problems that arise in groups: signs of conflict, withdrawal, factionalism, and group indecision, along with their crippling effect on the life of the group. Explains how to identify symptoms of group problems.
